website_summaries.verdict: Cut the cord on outdoor tasks such as pruning, cutting kindling, and clearing branches that get in the way.
pros: Jaw-shaped guard keeps the chain covered for safety
12-foot reach to get difficult to reach branches
Durable saw has steel teeth for better cut and stability
Pole saw has an automatic chain oiler and oil level indicator
cons: Unit can be heavy when extended

customer_reviews.title: worked for about 5 months
customer_reviews.text: Worked really good, until it didn't It started to do this funky thing where when you pushed the handle to activate the saw, it would only activate about half way. Then it stopped all the way. I mean, maybe getting 5 months use out of it was worth about 2 stars? Not sure. Oh you only have 30 days to get in that warranty BTW. So, if you get it as a gift early and did not send it, then forget that warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: This is HORRIBLE!! I read reviews and I thought I would be able to finally trim my overgrown tree. First thing is how heavy this is. I am a pretty in shape woman, But I literally couldn’t hold the saw with the pole extended much less for very long with just the saw. I have many WORX items but this is a total bust. Save your money he get a. Old fashioned pruner. I ended up grabbing one at my local hardware store for 45.00 and was easily able to hold it and trim my whole tree.
customer_reviews.author: crystal Bolduc

customer_reviews.title: Amazing tool
customer_reviews.text: I needed to trim branches off trees in the backyard. This tool is amazing, cut through them like butter and then once they are on the ground it cut them down in no time. This tool pays back for itself in the savings over paying a tree trimming company to come over. Just remember to ADD OIL before the first use. Also, you may want to buy a Chain Saw oil since the amount that comes with it is very little. Great tool, super safe - just perfect.
customer_reviews.author: PurpleDuck

customer_reviews.title: Strangler vines...beware!
customer_reviews.text: The gardener's version of "Jaws", this machine quickly dispatches invasive vines and dead branches. Safe and easy to use, it's a huge improvement over manual loppers. Understandably, it will take a bit of time before you're comfortable with using it then it will help you rip thru clearing out years of long-neglected tree choking vines. And, if we ever have an Zombie Apocalypse.....
customer_reviews.author: the professor

customer_reviews.title: Best. Saw. Ever.
customer_reviews.text: I would give it 6 stars if I could. If you have a lot of trees to trim, you need one of these. the pole is a little un-wieldy since the weight is all on the working end of it, but this thing cuts anything that fits in the jaws. We keep ours on the golf cart and as my wife and I cruise around our yard any limb that she thinks is out of place is gone in moments. And occasionally she will let me use it.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Top heavy
customer_reviews.text: Works for what I wanted it for. Is very top heavy, makes it hard to use above your head. If you aren’t very strong not the saw to use. Seems to be pretty durable. And so far the battery is lasting as long as I do.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra K Mathews

customer_reviews.title: Worx cordless chain saw.
customer_reviews.text: Used one time and put away for winter. When I brought out in spring it did not work. I thought it was the battery so I bought a new battery and still did not work. I found the motor frozen. I can not recommend and it is acqward to use.
customer_reviews.author: joseph engelhardt

customer_reviews.title: Feed your JawSaw. Chews through branches with ease.
customer_reviews.text: This was perfect for what I needed. Tore through brush and branches with ease. Plus safe enough for almost anyone to use. Can get a bit heavy with extension pole attached but other than that it was a great investment.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Smith

customer_reviews.title: Too heavy and difficult to use
customer_reviews.text: I returned the saw because it is too heavy for me especially when extended to reach tall branches. Not only is it heavy on the end which makes it unwieldly, but you have to push the saw into the branch to make it cut which makes it very difficult to use. I used it for about 40 minutes trimming high branches and my shoulders were on fire.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff S.

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm - no yanking on a chain saw ...
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm - no yanking on a chain saw cord - no noisy engine. Cuts through tree limbs like butter. It is a little heavy with the extension pole so my husband does the high up work and I do the lower trimming without the pole. I love it. Every WorX product is amazing. I have 2 weed eaters, the chainsaw, the blower and the hedge trimmer. These products make yard work so easy. I am waiting for WorX to make a rototiller now.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Harrigan

customer_reviews.title: I love this tool!
customer_reviews.text: I love this saw. It works great, the battery holds up well and it really will cut any tree or limb you can get the jaws around. I was very hesitant to buy it, but I don't like using a gas saw over my head and my wife doesn't like me having any power tool that runs on gas, so I gambled on this Worx saw and I'm glad I did. I can't speak to durability (yet), but it's been a big help since I got it.
customer_reviews.author: John M.

customer_reviews.title: Charge the battery five hours before use and fill oil reservoir. And then Stay hydrated
customer_reviews.text: I've not used the pole adapter but this Jaw Saw is way more than I ever expected. I needed a very safe way to cut small trees, the Jaw Saw did the job, the 20 volt battery and little charger seemed small, but it's very proficient and can easily sit and trickle charge while I'm away, I've never run the battery down, and I cleared a fence line.
customer_reviews.author: Micah Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Easy
customer_reviews.text: Saved me LOTS of money from hiring this out. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike P

customer_reviews.title: Best Saw EVER
customer_reviews.text: Best Saw EVER! To heavy for me to be able to use the extension pole but that was more for my husband anyway. Get the bigger battery to go with it. The one that comes with it is also good.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Answer for Someone Who Can't or Won't Use a Gas Chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: Everything they say about this tool is true. It is the answer for someone like me who won't use gas chain saws or someone who lives in areas that forbid gas engines all summer because of fire danger. I can clean up around my house year around. This saw is wonderfully easy to use and works perfectly for my purpose. My husband even likes it as well as his big time gas saws.
customer_reviews.author: Pat in So. Ore.

customer_reviews.title: Completely exceeds my expectations, love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: Ok just used this again and have to leave a review. Rarely have I purchased something that completely exceeded my expectations but this is one. If you have bushes and trees you need one of these, works better, faster, and easier than anything else I’ve used. Makes quick work of fallen limbs up to over 3”, I love this thing and will definitely replace it if I wear it out.
customer_reviews.author: Scott S.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Very excited to use the product but then very disappointed. The chain falls off every two cuts. I followed the instructions and understand how to tighten the tension. It’s not me it’s the product.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Martin

customer_reviews.title: Would like somebody to get back with me 847-302-8794 Mick Blake or Walter Blake
customer_reviews.text: Chain keeps falling off not exactly sure how to cut with it . Am I supposed to depress when I’m using the extension or just squeeze the trigger And should the lock key be taken out when cutting with it probably a video of how this all works would be better than trying to read all that information that is not exactly written well
customer_reviews.author: Walter Blake

customer_reviews.title: Batteries need to be bigger amps and charge in 20min
customer_reviews.text: Like the machine the 10 min it took for the battery to go flat to the 4-5hrs for recharge was untenable “ridiculous “ tried two of these because I thought first one was faulty
customer_reviews.author: Volvot6

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! I bought it with the extension pole, but find it is too heavy for me, a 50 year old woman, to lift overhead. But I have no problem using it w/o the extension. I agree with others that say a second battery isn't necessary because when it's done, I'm pretty much worn out too. I recommend it to anyone that can't or doesn't want to use a traditional chainsaw.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love it! Trimmed limbs on our trees, great product. Would recommend it to all!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy H.

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend or buy
customer_reviews.text: Chain keeps coming off. Would not recommend or buy again. Will cut 2 inch branches about its limit.
customer_reviews.author: david wentworth

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product for trimming the yard. Simple to use mu kid can use it covered blade is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: M :) Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Jaw Saw
customer_reviews.text: I tried it out after charging the battery and loved it. It was easy to use, even though I wasn't sure of what I was doing. I was trimming trees like crazy and learned how to use it the right way. Got the chain stuck but learned what to do then had to put the chain back on the bar. It was so easy to open the side and put the chain back on the bar. Would recommend this saw for small trees and trimming.
customer_reviews.author: JOJO

customer_reviews.title: Love this saw
customer_reviews.text: Love this saw, worth every penny.very easy to use. Saves you so much time. I did actally run out of battery a cPl of time but at least afer 1hr. I bough a huge gallon of oil. I Just fill it every time I get it out of the shed for use.
customer_reviews.author: MOOSE77

customer_reviews.title: fine item
customer_reviews.text: purchased twice, first one fell off roof and onto concrete, they do not sell replacement enclosures, but IT IS A GREAT TOOL> recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Bud Blubaugh

customer_reviews.title: This saw is easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This saw is easy to use, cuts great, and is fun. I started cutting low hanging limbs that kept getting in the way while I was cutting the grass. Before I knew it, over one hundred branches were on the ground, and the battery was still strong. The only bad thing is now I had to pick them up. That's not a good thing when your 69 years old and out of shape
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Very easy and convenient
customer_reviews.text: Very easy and convenient! Battery doesn't last very long but I have two batteries now! The ease of using this is worth changing the battery!
customer_reviews.author: Eric Roadstar

customer_reviews.title: This saw is heavy and not as discribed
customer_reviews.text: The picture of a woman using this saw is very misleading the saw itself without the pole is heavy and akward with the extension pole its alot worse .I cannot say anything good about it. Debre from cutting piles up inside the jaws.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick l.Beazley

customer_reviews.title: Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! Easy assembly. Easy use. I am 5'5" #120. Had no problem using with extension. Just primary handheld unit does most work required. Very handy for smaller jobs on ranch!
customer_reviews.author: LSmith

customer_reviews.title: Must have great buy
customer_reviews.text: This is the number one best pole saw I ever bought must have
customer_reviews.author: Tubby Tactical

customer_reviews.title: Broke to early
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this for 6 months. Barely used and it just stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Ocean

customer_reviews.title: Totally Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This branch trimmer is AWSOME. It truely is sturdy enough to make fallen branches the right size for yard cart & easy to use. When trimming small branches from tree the extender is needed. Only when trimming trees I found the equipment a bit to heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Frenchton Owner

customer_reviews.title: WORX Lithium Cordless Saw
customer_reviews.text: Except for being a bit heavy when using the extension, I love the way it zips through branches I could never have cut before. The claw holds well to allow for a smooth cut. The lithium ion battery recharges quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Works great until it doesnt
customer_reviews.text: After the 3rd use my unit stopped working. I thought maybe the battery died, but after charging it it was still dead. I opened it up and found a completely frayed wire inside. I was able to repair it, but not easily, this think is quite the puzzle to put back together.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Adams

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: Item works OK. I was hoping for a little more umph than what it has. But so far, it is serviceable.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Worked as advertised, battery holds up well and saved me what I paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Hollaway

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for yeard work.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this with the extension pole. Save your money on the pole. It's a lot of work and heavy when using. The saw is great and does the job well. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: George D Casaletto

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient tool to have for 3 inch branches and ...
customer_reviews.text: Very convenient tool to have for 3 inch branches and less. The small battery gives you about an hour of use.
customer_reviews.author: Montana17

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: it works! I've only used twice...weather turned too cold to play more.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great to use in Florida vegetation. Wonderful for Hurricane clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Linda S.

customer_reviews.title: This has been the best thing I have ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: This has been the best thing I have ever purchased. So easy for me, a woman, to handle. It is a little too heavy to hold with the extension, but I love it anyway!
customer_reviews.author: Judy Holland

customer_reviews.title: Works well on small branches.
customer_reviews.text: Cuts small branches well. Too heavy for me with the extension pole, but is fine without it.
customer_reviews.author: C.H.

customer_reviews.title: You must have this if you have trees.
customer_reviews.text: wow! Get one. So light on my worn out arms. Their products are ergonomically designed so you can adjust to your body size. I live next to a forest and need to keep limbs up for fire protection. Now I can do it and not have to wait for help. I love Worx "toys".
customer_reviews.author: Ellen A.

customer_reviews.title: 20V Jawsaw
customer_reviews.text: Really heavy and chain has come off twice in only a couple of attempts to use.
customer_reviews.author: L. Harrell

customer_reviews.title: too heavy for my wife
customer_reviews.text: Bought to appease my wife so she could safely trim limbs at her leisure. She's very independent which I support but with the ext handle attached she is unable to control due to weight!
customer_reviews.author: Tory Stokes

customer_reviews.title: Safest tool ever
customer_reviews.text: This saw is awesome safe and easy to use a great investment the batteries last great too
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: extension pole should be stronger,
customer_reviews.text: extension pole should be stronger , on light limbs limb does not have enough strength to force blade closed not a complete solution but would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Wadeinblue

customer_reviews.title: I love it. Fun to use!
customer_reviews.text: Really cool innovative tool. Looked cheap and gimmicky when it arrived, but it makes cutting really easy. Its actually fun to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty but light and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Love it,handled all of our trim needs. Wife even loves it. Extension is a big plus.
customer_reviews.author: Tim W

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: Good battery life works well for me, it's a little heavy with the extinction but usable.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra C.

customer_reviews.title: Bad battery
customer_reviews.text: We have used this jawsaw twice. It will only make a few cuts. When I put the battery on the charger, it flashes red which means it’s over heating. I contacted Worx and they basically want my first born child to send me a replacement battery. They also want to charge me shipping and handling.
customer_reviews.author: JLib

customer_reviews.title: It works great on trimming back our tree limbs
customer_reviews.text: So far, it works great on trimming back our tree limbs.
customer_reviews.author: V. J. Douglas

customer_reviews.title: easy to handle
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as specified; works on difficult trimming areas, easy to handle. Built strong and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Mary L. Emmitt

customer_reviews.title: Pretty impressive product
customer_reviews.text: Pretty impressive product. Battery lasted about 30-40 cuts while cutting down heavy scrub brush/trees around a pond. No worries of having an electric cord near water. Be sure to check the chain tension every 5 cuts or so (it's easy to adjust) and you'll be fine. Works as advertised!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unpacked it. Ran it for a short time and ...
customer_reviews.text: Unpacked it. Ran it for a short time and am storing it till I start pruning this fall. Its a lot heavier than I thought. Don't know if I should have bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Safe but flawed
customer_reviews.text: Very easy and safe to use, perfect for do-it-yourself types. It's very top heavy however and it's extension is worthless because of the lack of balance to this item. Misleading picture on the package shows a woman easily cutting high branches with the use of the extension to add length. That however is impossible due to the disproportionate weight of the saw.
customer_reviews.author: Rose Toledo

customer_reviews.title: Grandma loves it!!
customer_reviews.text: I had thought this would be much the same as my electric chain saw experience. To my surprise and delight I was wrong very little vibration in the handle during use. I have arthritis and can't stand the use of a regular or traditional electric saw. It has helped me trim my overgrown trees and is great for pruning. It is no toy as I suspected it truly does the work. It does seem extremely light weight so longevity is in question, but I have to give it 5 stars for now it's actually fun to use.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Sierer

customer_reviews.title: My son used this tool today, and he questioned ...
customer_reviews.text: My son used this tool today, and he questioned the strength of the 20 amp battery. It was a small job and it got it done. I have other worx tools and there has been no issue with performance.
customer_reviews.author: stephanie snyder

customer_reviews.title: I feel I wasted my money.  Just too heavy and bulky to use.  Battery doesnt last a normal job.
customer_reviews.text: Works but just too bulky and extreemly heavy at the cutting end even for a 270 lb 6'1" Man. Battery doesnt last except through a 2-or 3 branches of any size. Hard to push before saw cuts into branches. I bought it, tried to use it, and sits without use now. If you want mine you can have it free. Good for holding down tarp from strong winds. Manufacturer would not return because they said its return time has expired. Spend your $200 on something more useful.
customer_reviews.author: AllenCarCare C.

customer_reviews.title: disappointing product review
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed. While you can't register this item on Worx.com website due to the product number WITH extension pole, you have to hold onto this heavy at the motor end you have to push the handle towards the motor to get the blade to cross the opening. I tried to cut and 1 inch tree and NO. The tree was stronger than the cutting blade. If you are looking for something you may want to buy to do what product is supposed to do, I suggest keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: Gary W. Crane

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it is very heavy, but it really does a good job. Cuts through everything I have thrown at it.
customer_reviews.author: shawn finney

customer_reviews.title: Not satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: The chain fell off frequently. I'm having difficulty cutting anything. What are my return options?
customer_reviews.author: Robert M. Baxa

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed. My own relatively safe chainsaw when the men of the house won't share theirs.
customer_reviews.author: DNewman

customer_reviews.title: Clearly a tool for any adult
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, no ladder needed to trim low hanging limbs. Does not take up a lot of space; hangs on a peg board; little maintenance--no cords to trail. We have no need for fire-wood, but seems like it would be an easier cutting experience than a traditional chain saw--and safer as well.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia L Nelson

customer_reviews.title: I was very pleased with my cordless chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased with my cordless chainsaw. it saves me from climbing ladders to reach high limbs. the performance of this product exceeded my expectations.i can get more done in a shorter time
customer_reviews.author: george gauthier

customer_reviews.title: Easy to work with
customer_reviews.text: Easy to work with. Kind of heavy when trimming a high limb. Especially after the limb falls. Wish the extension was 2 ft longer. The battery lasted long. Finished a lot of cut and there was some juice left.
customer_reviews.author: Amer A. Mikati

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome little saw
customer_reviews.text: WOW!!! This is an awesome little saw. Easy to use and works great
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Acceptable performance
customer_reviews.text: Very effective on small branches. At 4 inches tends to jam get stuck or the chain comes off. 12 foot reach is minimally acceptable. Becomes heavy and awkward if you're going to be cutting a lot of branches. But all in all performs pretty much the way it is advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Don't be drawn in by the false advertising!
customer_reviews.text: One use and the jaws failed. I have not been able to use the saw since. I consider this a significant expenditure. To have an expensive nonfunctional tool is disheartening at best. Can no one be trusted? There will apparently be no acceptance of responsibility from the company therefore no refund or replacement. I can only recommend passing over this saw as a possible purchase and choosing an honest manufacturer and distributor.
customer_reviews.author: zachariah

customer_reviews.title: Great branch trimmer
customer_reviews.text: This item exceeded expectations and was simple to set up. Great branch trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Chris B.

customer_reviews.title: Works good on small down limb
customer_reviews.text: Works good on small down limb. If you need it to work more than 45 min you will have to get another battery.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence J. George

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I just love it. Easy for this 61yr old to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You have to make sure you change the chain frequently ...
customer_reviews.text: You have to make sure you change the chain frequently enough other wise you lose cutting power. Very handy tool to have around and I live in the city.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Schroeder

customer_reviews.title: Awful, had no power to cut palm fronds, ...
customer_reviews.text: Awful, had no power to cut palm fronds, also tried it on some smaller branches, just no power and took way to long to cut through most small branches...
customer_reviews.author: Ted B. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Cut down an entire tree with this and a couple of ropes. But invest in an extra battery.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Rauland

customer_reviews.title: Love i,t but heavy
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my husband for Father's Day. He said he is going to love it, but doesn't know if he can handle the weight of it with the extension pole attached.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy M. Bowe

customer_reviews.title: battery operated!
customer_reviews.text: Hubby loves his present! Love the battery and that everything was in one package. Powerful for what we need cleaning up tree limbs.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley H Jones

customer_reviews.title: Fun Gadget
customer_reviews.text: Fun gadget but not totally practical. Most cutting and trimming needs to be done by a regular chair saw. After things are cut down, then you can use this to trim the small branches, but not likely to get it out when you are standing there with the chain saw anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Bee

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this, so does everyone who sees me use it!
customer_reviews.author: S L.

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my sister who lives alone and has lots of trees to take care of. she loves it. says that it is very easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline D.

customer_reviews.title: Extension too heavy
customer_reviews.text: It works well but too heavy for me. When I added the extension, I had to ask my son to use it as it was too heavy. That was why I bought this in the first place but now have to have help.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: A well designed tool. It does exactly as advertised ...
customer_reviews.text: A well designed tool. It does exactly as advertised. I wish there was a battery. Safe and efficient. I also bought the Worx leaf vac- mulched. Even more incredible.
customer_reviews.author: STEPHEN J GIULIANI

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Works great first time out of the ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Works great first time out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: KPnFW

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: You could not cut your finger must less cut it off with this under powered piece of crap. I will never be sucked in by buying anything from Worx again.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Cooper

product_meta.title: Worx WG321 20V Power Share Cordless 6-inch JawSaw Chainsaw with 5-ft Extension Pole
product_meta.description: The Worx WG321 cordless Jawsaw with extension takes all the cutting abilities of the Jawsaw and makes it cordless. Now you can prune, cut kindling and saw debris without the cord. This cordless 20-volt lithium powered Jawsaw is the battery-powered chain saw that will go anywhere. It's super safe. The chain is enclosed in the blade guard, helping to protect the user from contact with the chain compared to regular chain saws. It's virtually maintenance free. The Jawsaw patented system automatically sets the proper chain tension for you. Also, the Jawsaw has an automatic chain oiler with oil level indicator. Simply keep the oil level filled and the saw will oil itself. The great thing about the Jawsaw is its ability to cut directly on the ground. No more propping or bending to make a ground cut. Also, with the extension, the Jawsaw can reach up to 12-feet for pruning or limbing branches. This makes the Jawsaw the perfect saw for cleanup after a storm, clearing debris and cutting up downed branches.
feature_bullets: Guard covers chain for enhanced safety
Extension pole allows for a reach up to 12 feet or more
Steel teeth hold work in place while cutting for stability
Auto-Tension feature sets the proper tension. Charging time - 3 hours. Oil Tank Capacity - 30 ML. No-Load Speed - 1350/min
Automatic chain oiler with oil level indicator

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars153 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
